CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Photovoltaic effects of PCDSeBT were investigated in BHJ PSCs with the device structures of the standard configuration glass / ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PCDSeBT : PC71BM / Al. The PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio was optimized from 1 : 1 , 1 : 2 , 1 : 3 , to 1 : 4. The current-density-voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the devices under the illumination of simulated AM 1.5G conditions ( 100 mW / cm^2 ) are shown in Figure 4a and the parameters are summarized in Table 2. Without extensive optimization , the initial device fabricated from the blend solutions with a PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio of 1 : 1 shows a PCE of 0.73% with a J SC of 2.98 mA / cm^2 , a V OC of 0.71 V , a fill factor ( FF ) of 35% . As increasing the weight fraction of PC71BM , the PCEs are gradually increased. The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ). 20 It is worth noting that the J SC , to the best of our knowledge , is among the highest J SC s reported to date for PCSs based on PCDTBT analogues , 5,8,21 in a good agreement with the 1.0 × 10^-3 4.0 × 10^4 -13 a All device characteristics were obtained from the devices ( L = 50 μm and W = 1.5 mm ) based on OTS - treated Si / SiO 2 substrates. b The on / off current ratio ( I on / I off ) were extracted from the linear - regime transfer characteristics. In order to ensure the accuracy of the measurements , we investigated the incident photon - to - current efficiency ( IPCE ) spectrum of the optimized device ( 1 : 4 w / w ) , exhibiting over 65% at the energetically lower peak , i.e. at the λ max of PCDSeBT ( Figure 4b ). The J SC value calculated by integrating the IPCE data with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum is rather consistent with that obtained from J-V plots within 10% error. Atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed to gain insight into the surface morphology of the optimized 1 : 4 w / w blend films ( Figure 5 ). The films before and after thermal annealing have smooth surface topographies and very similar features , where the formation of voids , typically attributed to incompatibility between donor and acceptor components , is not observed.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph!

1. Photovoltaic effects of PCDSeBT: This is a material name entity.
2. BHJ PSCs: This is a material name entity, referring to a type of photovoltaic cell.
3. PEDOT : PSS: This is a material name entity, referring to a type of conducting polymer.
4. PC71BM: This is a material name entity, referring to a type of organic photovoltaic material.
5. PCDSeBT: This is a material name entity, referring to a type of organic photovoltaic material.
6. Al: This is a material name entity, referring to a metal used in the device structure.
7. ITO: This is a material name entity, referring to a transparent conductive oxide used in the device structure.
8. Si / SiO2: This is a material name entity, referring to a type of substrate material.
9. OTS: This is a material name entity, referring to a treatment process used on the substrate.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the material name entities in the text:

1. PCDSeBT
2. PC71BM

I have removed the irrelevant entities from the list. Let me know if you have any further questions!

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid material name entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDSeBT |
| PC71BM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Photovoltaic effects of PCDSeBT were investigated in BHJ PSCs with the device structures of the standard configuration glass / ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PCDSeBT : PC71BM / Al. The PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio was optimized from 1 : 1 , 1 : 2 , 1 : 3 , to 1 : 4. The current-density-voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the devices under the illumination of simulated AM 1.5G conditions ( 100 mW / cm^2 ) are shown in Figure 4a and the parameters are summarized in Table 2. Without extensive optimization , the initial device fabricated from the blend solutions with a PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio of 1 : 1 shows a PCE of 0.73% with a J SC of 2.98 mA / cm^2 , a V OC of 0.71 V , a fill factor ( FF ) of 35% . As increasing the weight fraction of PC71BM , the PCEs are gradually increased. The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ). 20 It is worth noting that the J SC , to the best of our knowledge , is among the highest J SC s reported to date for PCSs based on PCDTBT analogues , 5,8,21 in a good agreement with the 1.0 × 10^-3 4.0 × 10^4 -13 a All device characteristics were obtained from the devices ( L = 50 μm and W = 1.5 mm ) based on OTS - treated Si / SiO 2 substrates. b The on / off current ratio ( I on / I off ) were extracted from the linear - regime transfer characteristics. In order to ensure the accuracy of the measurements , we investigated the incident photon - to - current efficiency ( IPCE ) spectrum of the optimized device ( 1 : 4 w / w ) , exhibiting over 65% at the energetically lower peak , i.e. at the λ max of PCDSeBT ( Figure 4b ). The J SC value calculated by integrating the IPCE data with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum is rather consistent with that obtained from J-V plots within 10% error. Atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed to gain insight into the surface morphology of the optimized 1 : 4 w / w blend films ( Figure 5 ). The films before and after thermal annealing have smooth surface topographies and very similar features , where the formation of voids , typically attributed to incompatibility between donor and acceptor components , is not observed.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the property names of materials in the paragraph! Here are the materials mentioned in the paragraph along with their property names:

1. Photovoltaic material: PCDSeBT
 * Property name: Photovoltaic material
2. Polymer: PEDOT
 * Property name: Conducting polymer
3. PSS: PSS (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))
 * Property name: Conducting polymer
4. PC71BM: PC71BM (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))
 * Property name: Conducting polymer
5. Al: Aluminum
 * Property name: Metal
6. ITO: ITO (Indium tin oxide)
 * Property name: Transparent conductive oxide
7. Si: Silicon
 * Property name: Semiconductor material
8. SiO2: SiO2 (Silicon dioxide)
 * Property name: Insulating material
9. OTS: OTS (Organic thin-film solar cells)
 * Property name: Type of solar cell
10. AM 1.5G: AM 1.5G (Air mass 1.5 global solar irradiance)
 * Property name: Standard solar irradiance spectrum

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to the property name of materials in the paragraph:

1. PCDSeBT: Photovoltaic material
2. PC71BM: Conducting polymer
3. PSS: Conducting polymer
4. Al: Metal

I removed the following entities that do not refer to the property name of materials:

1. ITO: Transparent conductive oxide (this refers to a type of transparent conductive oxide, but not a material property)
2. Si: Silicon (this refers to a material, but not a property name)
3. SiO2: Insulating material (this refers to a material, but not a property name)
4. OTS: Organic thin-film solar cells (this refers to a type of solar cell, but not a material property)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Photovoltaic effects of PCDSeBT were investigated in BHJ PSCs with the device structures of the standard configuration glass / ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PCDSeBT : PC71BM / Al. The PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio was optimized from 1 : 1 , 1 : 2 , 1 : 3 , to 1 : 4. The current-density-voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the devices under the illumination of simulated AM 1.5G conditions ( 100 mW / cm^2 ) are shown in Figure 4a and the parameters are summarized in Table 2. Without extensive optimization , the initial device fabricated from the blend solutions with a PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio of 1 : 1 shows a PCE of 0.73% with a J SC of 2.98 mA / cm^2 , a V OC of 0.71 V , a fill factor ( FF ) of 35% . As increasing the weight fraction of PC71BM , the PCEs are gradually increased. The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ). 20 It is worth noting that the J SC , to the best of our knowledge , is among the highest J SC s reported to date for PCSs based on PCDTBT analogues , 5,8,21 in a good agreement with the 1.0 × 10^-3 4.0 × 10^4 -13 a All device characteristics were obtained from the devices ( L = 50 μm and W = 1.5 mm ) based on OTS - treated Si / SiO 2 substrates. b The on / off current ratio ( I on / I off ) were extracted from the linear - regime transfer characteristics. In order to ensure the accuracy of the measurements , we investigated the incident photon - to - current efficiency ( IPCE ) spectrum of the optimized device ( 1 : 4 w / w ) , exhibiting over 65% at the energetically lower peak , i.e. at the λ max of PCDSeBT ( Figure 4b ). The J SC value calculated by integrating the IPCE data with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum is rather consistent with that obtained from J-V plots within 10% error. Atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed to gain insight into the surface morphology of the optimized 1 : 4 w / w blend films ( Figure 5 ). The films before and after thermal annealing have smooth surface topographies and very similar features , where the formation of voids , typically attributed to incompatibility between donor and acceptor components , is not observed.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, let's go through the values of material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. PCDSeBT:
 * Weight ratio: 1 : 1, 1 : 2, 1 : 3, 1 : 4
 * Current-density-voltage (J-V) characteristics: shown in Figure 4a
 * Photovoltaic efficiency (PCE): 0.73%, 4.12% (with thermal annealing at 150°C)
2. PC71BM:
 * Weight ratio: 1 : 1, 1 : 2, 1 : 3, 1 : 4
 * Current-density-voltage (J-V) characteristics: shown in Figure 4a
 * Photovoltaic efficiency (PCE): 0.73%, 4.12% (with thermal annealing at 150°C)
3. Si:
 * Substrate material
 * Thickness: 50 μm
 * Width: 1.5 mm
4. SiO2:
 * Substrate material
5. OTS:
 * Treatment method for Si substrate
6. AM 1.5G:
 * Simulated solar irradiance spectrum with a peak wavelength of 365 nm
7. FF:
 * Fill factor (ratio of active area to total area)
8. J SC:
 * Short-circuit current density (in mA/cm2)
9. V OC:
 * Open-circuit voltage (in V)
10. IPCE:
 * Incident photon-to-current efficiency (%)
11. AFM:
 * Atomic force microscopy (a technique for surface morphology analysis)

Note that some of these values are mentioned in the paragraph, while others are calculated or extracted from the J-V plots or IPCE spectrum.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to the value of material properties in the given text:

1. PCE: The photovoltaic efficiency (PCE) of the devices was improved from 0.73% to 4.12% with thermal annealing at 150°C.
2. J SC: The short-circuit current density (J SC) of the devices was measured to be 2.98 mA/cm2.
3. V OC: The open-circuit voltage (V OC) of the devices was measured to be 0.71 V.
4. FF: The fill factor (FF) of the devices was calculated to be 35%.

These are the only entities in the text that directly refer to the value of material properties.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.
